t: Revelation 18
The Fall of Babylon
After*p this I saw another angel coming down from heaven, having great authority, and the earth was made bright with his glory.

And he called out with a mighty voice, “Fallen,*pn fallen is Babylon the great! She*ld has become a dwelling place for demons, a*ln haunt for every unclean spirit, a*ld haunt for every unclean bird, a*ld haunt for every unclean and detestable beast.

For*ln all nations have drunk the*ld wine of the passion of her sexual immorality, and*ln the kings of the earth have committed immorality with her, and*ld the merchants of the earth have grown rich from the power of her luxurious living.”
Then*p I heard another voice from heaven saying, “Come*pn out of her, my people, lest*ld you take part in her sins, lest*ln you share in her plagues;
for*ln her sins are heaped high as heaven, and*ld God has remembered her iniquities.
Pay*ln her back as she herself has paid back others, and*ld repay her double for her deeds; mix*ld a double portion for her in the cup she mixed.

As*ln she glorified herself and lived in luxury, so*ld give her a like measure of torment and mourning, since*ln in her heart she says, ‘I*ld sit as a queen, I*ln am no widow, and*ld mourning I shall never see.’
For*ln this reason her plagues will come in a single day, death*ld and mourning and famine, and*ln she will be burned up with fire; for*ld mighty is the Lord God who has judged her.”
And*p the kings of the earth, who committed sexual immorality and lived in luxury with her, will weep and wail over her when they see the smoke of her burning.
They will stand far off, in fear of her torment, and say, “Alas!*pn Alas! You great city, you*ld mighty city, Babylon! For*ln in a single hour your judgment has come.”
And*p the merchants of the earth weep and mourn for her, since no one buys their cargo anymore,

cargo of gold, silver, jewels, pearls, fine linen, purple cloth, silk, scarlet cloth, all kinds of scented wood, all kinds of articles of ivory, all kinds of articles of costly wood, bronze, iron and marble,
cinnamon, spice, incense, myrrh, frankincense, wine, oil, fine flour, wheat, cattle and sheep, horses and chariots, and slaves, that is, human souls.
“The*pn fruit for which your soul longed has*ld gone from you, and*ln all your delicacies and your splendors are*ld lost to you, never*ld to be found again!”
The*p merchants of these wares, who gained wealth from her, will stand far off, in fear of her torment, weeping and mourning aloud,
“Alas,*pn alas, for the great city that*ld was clothed in fine linen, in*ld purple and scarlet, adorned*ld with gold, with*ld jewels, and with pearls!
For*ln in a single hour all this wealth has been laid waste.” And*p all shipmasters and seafaring men, sailors and all whose trade is on the sea, stood far off
and cried out as they saw the smoke of her burning, “What*pn city was like the great city?”

And*p they threw dust on their heads as they wept and mourned, crying out, “Alas,*pn alas, for the great city where*ld all who had ships at sea grew*ld rich by her wealth! For*ln in a single hour she has been laid waste.
Rejoice*ln over her, O heaven, and*ld you saints and apostles and prophets, for*ln God has given judgment for you against her!”
Then*p a mighty angel took up a stone like a great millstone and threw it into the sea, saying, “So*pn will Babylon the great city be thrown down with violence, and*ld will be found no more;

and*ln the sound of harpists and musicians, of flute players and trumpeters, will*ld be heard in you no more, and*ln a craftsman of any craft will*ld be found in you no more, and*ln the sound of the mill will*ld be heard in you no more,

and*ln the light of a lamp will*ld shine in you no more, and*ln the voice of bridegroom and bride will*ld be heard in you no more, for*ln your merchants were the great ones of the earth, and*ld all nations were deceived by your sorcery.
And*ln in her was found the blood of prophets and of saints, and*ld of all who have been slain on earth.”
